ANU.name: Ray Lovett
expertise: Aboriginal And Torres Strait Islander Health
Public Health And Health Services Not Elsewhere Classified
interest: Cohort StudiesSocial EpidemiologyCultural determinants of health and wellbeingPsychometricsData Sovereignty and Governance
ANU.biography: Dr Raymond Lovett BN, RN, BHSc, MAE, PhD is a Senior Research Fellow with the Epidemiology for Policy and Practice group at the National Centre for Epidemiology and Population Health, The Australian National University. He also holds an adjunct Fellowship at the Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies (AIATSIS) in the Indigenous Social and Cultural Wellbeing group. Ray is an Aboriginal (Ngiyampaa/Wongaibon) epidemiologist with extensive experience in health services research, large scale data analysis for public health policy development and evaluation.
project: Mayi Kuwayu: The National Study of Aborginal and Torres Strait Islander Wellbeing.
